item.description:
Another chance to see Sebastian Koch und Martina Gedeck.  This is part of a new series called "Thinking Through Film" being offered at Trinity College.

A discussion follows the film showing

Wed, February 13, 7:30pm – 7:30pm

WhereCinestudio (map) Description(Germany, 2006) Written and directed by Florian Henckel von Donnersmarck. With music by Gabriel Yared. Cast: Sebastian Koch, Ulrich Mühe, Martina Gedeck. Cinestudio and the new Thinking Through Film series present what is arguably the best film made on living under a police state. Set in 1984 in the German Democratic Republic, two very different men navigate a poisonous system of secrets. One is a famous playwright trying to let the West know about the brutality around him; the second is a loyal Stasi agent assigned to listen in on the writer and his actress girlfriend. An elegant story that catches a dictatorship on the edge of collapse: North Korea, take note. “Von Donnersmarck’s aim is to show not how susceptible human beings are to fear and coercion, but to underscore their capacity for compassion and change.” - Stephanie Zacharek, Salon.com Winner, Academy Award® for Best Foreign Film. 138 min. Part of the Thinking Through Film series - an open discussion will follow the screening. www.sonyclassic​s.com/theliveso​fothers   Eintrittskarte: $9                      $7 Studenten
item.name: Das Leben der Anderen
